page.title: 17Gardening in Cattistock
page.content: An annual event in Cattistock is the Garden Walkabout. 20 gardens are open for one afternoon in June in aid of Church and charity. Teas and locally grown plants are on sale and over 90 people are involved in the organisation. The gardens range from the small orderly, shrubs from cuttings, alpines, organic and herbs, old fashioned cottage, walled and formal, vegetables only, to gardens planted for easy care. All are colourful and cared for. Many old and unusual plants are grown from seed and cuttings. One garden is open weekly and specializes in endangered species, many variegated shrubs and plants and unusual ground cover. The eight village allotments on glebe land are not now widely used. They are some distance from the houses.
